content:
• Friday, October 18, 2019

  • MNK, ENDP, YNDX and AM among notable after hours movers

    • Gainers: YNDX +3.5%. FOMX +2.6%. AM +2.6%. RVNC +1.8%. DERM +1%.
    • Losers: KWR -6.9%.  MNK -3.4%. ENDP -2.8%.ARDX -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM | 6 Comments

  • Huge opioid settlement hits late snag

    • The first federal case in the opioid crisis seems headed to trial Monday after an 11th-hour settlement appeared to be breaking down.
    • A $50B bid from four state AGs and corporate executives to settle hundreds of lawsuits and head off the federal trial faced opposition from local officials.
    • There's been no progress in getting three distributors -- McKesson (NYSE:MCK), Cardinal Health (NYSE:CAH) and AmerisourceBergen (NYSE:ABC) -- to boost a settlement offer from $18B over 18 years, according to the lead attorney for 2,400 cities and counties.
    • And Teva (NYSE:TEVA) isn't budging from its offer of a few hundred million dollars plus anti-addiction drugs, and there's been little negotiation with Walgreens (NASDAQ:WBA), he says.
    • Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) has agreed to contribute $4B over a shorter time frame.
    • After hours: MCK -3.1%; CAH -3%; ABC -1.8%; WBA -0.4%; JNJ +0.1%; ENDP -2.4%; TEVA -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM | 259 Comments

  • MSFT, ORCL, VMW most defensible stocks - BMO

    • BMO says software valuations are still elevated compared to historical trends and further macro deterioration could add more pressure.
    • If the economic deterioration does happen, BMO sees Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT), Oracle (NYSE:ORCL), and VMware (NYSE:VMW) as having the "most defensible" valuations, Atlassian (NASDAQ:TEAM) as the most defensible business model, and reiterates Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) as a top pick.
    • Related: Atlassian's mostly in-line FY guidance yesterday led software stocks into the red.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 36 Comments
  • FOMX

    FDA OK's Foamix topical acne foam

    • The FDA approves Foamix Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:FOMX) AMZEEQ (minocycline) topical foam, 4% (formerly FMX101) for the treatment of inflammatory lesions of non-nodular moderate-to-severe acne vulgaris in patients at least nine years old.
    • Update: Shares, currently halted, will resume trading at 4:40 pm ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 6 Comments
  • TPRE

    Third Point Reinsurance gets boost after report it's reviewing options

    • Third Point Reinsurance (NYSE:TPRE) jumps 2.2% after Insurance Insider reports that TPRE is working with JPMorgan to review alternatives, including acquisitions and mergers.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 6 Comments
  • TLGT

    FDA OKs Teligent gentamicin cream; shares up 14%

    • The FDA approves Teligent's (TLGT +13.7%) Gentamicin Sulfate Cream USP, 0.1%.
    • Per IQVIA, the U.S. market is ~$15.6M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • NVR

    NVR +2.3% as Q3 beats on 11% rise in new orders

    • NVR (NYSE:NVR) gains 2.3% after Q3 EPS beat the average analyst estimate of $51.52 and rose from $48.28 in the year-ago quarter.
    • Q3 consolidated revenue of $1.91B exceeded the 1.84B consensus estimate and increased 3% from $1.85B in the year-ago quarter.
    • Q3 new orders rose 11% Y/Y to 4,766 units, while the average sales price of new orders fell 1% to $369,200.
    • Q3 homebuilding revenue of $1.87B rose 4% Y/Y; gross profit margin increased to 19.0% vs. 18.6% a year ago.
    • Q3 mortgage loan production was $1.37B, up 10% Y/Y.
    • Previously: NVR EPS beats by $4.59, beats on revenue (Oct. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • NLY

    Annaly bounces after Bill Gross mention

    • Annaly Capital Management (NLY +1.6%) took a bump up in afternoon trading after Bill Gross said he's buying the stock as it appears the 2s-10s yield spread will widen.
    • The Fed's move to buy Treasury bills should widen the yield curve, which bodes well for mortgage REITs and banks, he said in an interview on CNBC.
    • "I'm in there for the yield," he said. "I like high dividend-paying stocks."
    • Invesco (IVZ +1.6%) is another stock that he likes.
    • Gross, who co-founded Pimco, retired from Janus Henderson in March.
    • Among other stocks mentioned in the interview: Gross sold his Dominion (D -0.1%) shares and thinks there's an arbritrage opportunity with AbbVie's (ABBV +2.1%). PPL (PPL -0.1%) is as "good play on Brexit," he said.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 89 Comments

  • Micro Focus +6.8% after takeover interest - Bloomberg

    • Micro Focus (NYSE:MFGP) gains 6.8% after Bloomberg reports that Open Text (NASDAQ:OTEX) is considering a takeover bid.
    • Open Text is speaking with potential advisors while Micro Focus conducts a strategic review that include a sale.
    • No final decisions have been made and the details could change.
    • OTEX shares are down 3.3%.
    • Post updated with additional details.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 9 Comments
  • FOMX

    Foamix shares halted pending news

    • Nasdaq has suspended trading in Foamix Pharmaceuticals (FOMX -2.5%) pending the release of news. In this case, it pertains to the FDA's expected decision on its application for acne foam FMX101 today (the actual PDUFA date is Sunday, October 20).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • PUMP

    SEC probes ProPetro over accounting, disclosures - Reuters

    • ProPetro (PUMP -9.3%) plunges following a Reuters headline that the company is under SEC investigation over its financial accounting and disclosures.
    • The probe involves potential violations of securities laws covering disclosures, internal financial controls and public reporting, according to the report.
    • PUMP has been conducting its own investigation into equipment purchases and expense reimbursements, and recently said the review had not uncovered any matters that would require a restatement of past results.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM

  • EXFO, LPSN and WORK among tech movers

    • Gainers: Mer Telemanagement Solutions (NASDAQ:MTSL) +17%. Qumu Corporation (NASDAQ:QUMU) +14%. EXFO (NASDAQ:EXFO) +10%. inTEST Corporation (NYSEMKT:INTT) +6%. Aethlon Medical (NASDAQ:AEMD) +5%.
    • Losers: SPI Energy (NASDAQ:SPI) -10%. Jianpu Technology (NYSE:JT) -9%. Slack Technologies (NYSE:WORK) -9%. LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN) -9%. Luokung Technology (NASDAQ:LKCO) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • XOG

    Colorado to enact stricter review of drilling near homes

    • Colorado oil and gas producers trade in the red after the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment releases a report finding increased risk of benzene exposure within 2K ft. of drill sites: XOG -7.5%, SRCI -7.2%, PDCE -6.5%, HPR -4%, SM -3.6%, BCEI -2.4%, NBL -2%, WLL -1.5%.
    • The study examined well pads that are in pre-production, including drilling, fracking and flowback, not well pads that are currently producing oil and gas.
    • In response, the head of the Colorado Oil and Gas Conservation Commission says the group will "immediately enact stricter and safer precautionary review measures to protect public health, safety, welfare, the environment and wildlife."
    • Current state law prohibits oil and gas facilities from being closer than 500 ft. from homes and 1K ft. from schools, health care centers and other high-occupancy buildings.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 19 Comments
  • EBR

    Eletrobras privatization bill set for early November - Reuters

    • Eletrobras (EBR +6%) shares surge on renewed privatization hopes, as Reuters reports Brazil's Congress could evaluate a privatization bill early next month.
    • "I plan to deliver this project to Congress in person," says minister Bento Albuquerque, who previously said the bill would be sent to Congress in October.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM

  • Sierra Metals and Holly Energy Partners among Energy/Materials gainers; Key Energy Services and Ring Energy among losers

    • Gainers: Sierra Metals (NYSEMKT:SMTS) +21%. Holly Energy Partners (NYSE:HEP) +10%. Contango Oil & Gas (NYSEMKT:MCF) +9%. Insteel Industries (NASDAQ:IIIN) +6%. Pacific Coast Oil Trust (NYSE:ROYT) +5%.
    • Losers: Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) -9%. Ring Energy (NYSEMKT:REI) -9%. Antero Resources (NYSE:AR) -9%. CARBO Ceramics (NYSE:CRR) -8%. SRC Energy (NYSEMKT:SRCI) -7%.

  • ACU

    Acme United reports mixed Q3 results and updated Q4 outlook

    • Acme United (ACU +3.6%) reports net sales rose 7% in Q3.
    • Net sales in U.S. increased 6%; Europe advanced 15%; Canada grew 5%.
    • Gross margin rate down 30 bps to 35.5%.
    • Operating margin rate up 70 bps to 4.7%.
    • The company expects net sales of ~$142M vs. prior guidance range of $140M to $143M; net income of ~$5.2M vs. prior range of $5M to $5.3M; and earnings per share of ~$1.48 vs. prior range of $1.41 to $1.50.
    • Previously: Acme United EPS beats by $0.04, misses on revenue (Oct. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • BYND

    Beyond Meat -6% on Bernstein caution

    • Beyond Meat (NASDAQ:BYND) falls after Bernstein lowers its price target to $130 from $172 as it assigns a lower enterprise value to sales multiple to the alternative protein upstart.
    • The firm also thinks investors will want to be reassured during the Beyond Meat earnings call on October 28 that new next-gen protein competition across the food sector won't slow down the company's growth projections.
    • BYND -5.65% to $110.32, the lowest level for shares since the early part of June.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM | 35 Comments

  • ClearSign Combustion and Ideal Power among industrial gainers; Losers none

    • Gainers: Attis Industries (NASDAQ:ATIS) +28%. Ideal Power (NASDAQ:IPWR) +27%. ClearSign Combustion (NASDAQ:CLIR) +17%. Air Industries (NYSEMKT:AIRI) +8%. The New Home Company (NYSE:NWHM) +6%.

  • NVTR

    Nuvectra up 19% on advancement of Virtis application in U.S.

    • Nano cap Nuvectra (NVTR +19.1%) is up on a 9x surge in volume in reaction to its announcement that it has submitted supplementary chemical composition and biocompatibility data to the FDA per its request related to the company's marketing application seeking approval of its Virtis Sacral Neuromodulation device for the treatment of chronic urinary retention and symptoms of overactive bladder.
    • It originally filed the application in February 2017 followed by an amendment in April 2018 but a decision from the FDA has been repeatedly delayed due to requests for additional data.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 1 Comment

    • Gainers: Bionano Genomics (NASDAQ:BNGO) +85%. Greenland Acquisition Corporation (NASDAQ:GLAC) +52%. Attis Industries (NASDAQ:ATIS) +31%. Dermira (NASDAQ:DERM) +26%. Nuvectra Corporation (NASDAQ:NVTR) +21%. Mer Telemanagement Solutions (NASDAQ:MTSL) +18%. ClearSign Combustion (NASDAQ:CLIR) +18%. Applied Therapeutics (NASDAQ:APLT) +13%. Hepion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:HEPA) -14%. HyreCar (NASDAQ:HYRE) -13%. Tyme Technologies (NASDAQ:TYME) -11%. Mirati Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MRTX) -11%. ENDRA Life Sciences (NASDAQ:NDRA) -11%. JanOne (NASDAQ:JAN) -10%.

  • ATHM

    Autohome -2.2% alongside CLSA downgrade

    • Autohome ADRs (NYSE:ATHM) are off 2.2% today following a cut to Outperform at CLSA.
    • Sell-side analysts rate it Outperform on average, and Seeking Alpha authors are Bullish overall; it has a Quant Rating of Neutral.
    • The company's set to report earnings Nov. 7; consensus expectations are for EPS of $0.84 on revenues of $307.6M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM

  • Boeing drops 3.3% as messages suggest FAA was misled on MAX

    • Boeing (NYSE:BA) has made a sudden leg down, -3.3%, after word the FAA is demanding explanations on the 737 Max after instant messages Boeing found months ago suggested employees misled the agency about a key safety system.
    • "Yesterday, Boeing alerted the Department of Transportation to the existence of instant messages between two Boeing employees, characterizing certain communications with the FAA during the original certification of the 737 MAX in 2016," the FAA says, according to media reports.
    • That's "concerning," the agency says.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 381 Comments

  • Lifeway Foods only consumer gainer; Beyond Meat and Gildan Activewear among losers

    • Gainers: Lifeway Foods (NASDAQ:LWAY) +7%.
    • Losers: Gildan Activewear (NYSE:GIL) -24%. Beyond Meat (NASDAQ:BYND) -6%. Forward Industries (NASDAQ:FORD) -6%. Coca-Cola FEMSA (NYSE:KOF) -5%. SunOpta (NASDAQ:STKL) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLIR

    ClearSign announces engineering order from ExxonMobil

    • ClearSign Combustion (CLIR +19%) has received a Purchase Order from ExxonMobil to perform early engineering and installation planning regarding a trial installation of the company's ClearSign Core process burners at one of their Gulf Coast refineries.
    • "This engineering order is one of the final steps prior to qualifying our ClearSign Core process burner technology for use in an ExxonMobil refinery, and is a significant milestone for our company in the process of demonstrating our technology with a supermajor at their facility”, said Jim Deller, Ph.D, CEO of ClearSign.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 12 Comments
  • NE

    Noble adds two rig extensions in latest fleet status report

    • Noble Corp. (NE -1.9%) secured a contract extension for a drillship in South America and another extension for a jack-up rig offshore U.K., according to its latest quarterly fleet status report.
    • NE says Apache exercised two of three option wells for the Noble Sam Croft drillship, extending the contract to March 2020.
    • Bassoe Offshore estimates the dayrate for the contract with Apache is $170K; the rig's previous dayrate with W&T in the Gulf of Mexico was estimated at $160K.
    • Also, Spirit Energy has exercised a final option for the Noble Hans Deul jack-up rig, extending the contract to April 2020; the rig currently is operating in the U.K. for an undisclosed dayrate.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM

  • Nokia, Telia building network at biggest Nordic shopping center

    • Nokia (NOK -0.3%) and Telia (TLSNY +1.8%) are launching a 5G network at Helsinki's new Mall of Tripla, the biggest shopping center in the Nordic countries.
    • The intent is testing new retail and lifestyle experiences using Nokia's 5G base stations and small cells.
    • In store, retailers will be able to use AR and VR, facial and video recognition, and tailored in-store signage, the companies say, along with greater control over stock levels and supply chain, video analytics of customer behavior, and in-store robotics.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 10 Comments

  • Atlassian print leads software stocks lower

    • Software stocks are seeing red after yesterday's Atlassian (TEAM -8.3%) earnings report beat estimates but guided a mostly in-line FY performance.
    • Movers include Slack (WORK -9.7%), Alteryx (AYX -6.1%), Coupa Software (COUP -6.4%), and MongoDB (MDB -6.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 13 Comments
  • SXT

    Sensient Technologies down 9% post Q3 earnings miss

    • Sensient Technologies (SXT -9.8%) reported Q2 revenue decline of 7.3% Y/Y to $317.65M. Revenue by segments: Flavors & Fragrances $167.58M (-9.1% Y/Y); Color $127.01M (-6% Y/Y); and Asia Pacific $30.13M (-3.7% Y/Y).
    • Q3 Operating margin declined by 245 bps to 12.2%.
    • Q3 Adj. EBITDA was $53.09M (-15.8% Y/Y); and margin declined by 168 bps to 16.7%.
    • Net cash provided by operating activities YTD was $127.58M, compared to $8.86M a year ago.
    • FY19 Outlook: EPS $2.90 to $3.00; company expect full year local currency adjusted EBITDA to be below last year’s results.
    • Previously: Sensient Technologies EPS misses by $0.05, misses on revenue (Oct. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • DERM

    Dermira up 29% on additional mid-stage data on dermatitis med lebrikizumab

    • Dermira (DERM +28.5%) is up on a 9x surge in volume on the heels of detailed results from a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating a range of doses of lebrikizumab in adolescent and adult patients with moderate-to-severe atopic dermatitis (AD). The data are being presented at the Annual Fall Dermatology Conference in Las Vegas.
    • As reported in March, the 280-subject study met the primary endpoint of a statistically significant improvement in an AD scale called EASI at week 16 compared to placebo across all doses tested.
    • All key secondary endpoints were also met, including changes in pruritis (itchy skin) and sleep loss scores. No new safety signals were observed.
    • Phase 3 development is underway.
    • Lebrikizumab is an injectable humanized monoclonal antibody that binds to (inhibits) a pro-inflammatory protein called interleukin-13 (IL-13).
    • The company will host a conference call today at 4:45 pm ET to discuss the results.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM

  • Dermira and Nuvectra among healthcare gainers; Mirati Therapeutics leads the losers

    • Gainers: Bionano Genomics (NASDAQ:BNGO) +55%. Dermira (NASDAQ:DERM) +30%. Nuvectra (NASDAQ:NVTR) +29%. Menlo Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MNLO) +15%. Check-Cap (NASDAQ:CHEK) +13%.
    • Losers: Mirati Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MRTX) -11%. Hepion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:HEPA) -10%. Can-Fite BioPharma (NYSEMKT:CANF) -9%. BIOLASE (NASDAQ:BIOL) -9%. Tyme Technologies (NASDAQ:TYME) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • WEYL

    Weyland Tech expects positive adjusted EBITDA for Q3; shares +12%

    • Weyland Tech (OTCQX:WEYL +12.8%) expects Q3 revenue of ~$9.0M (+6.6% Y/Y). WEYL expects record revenue of ~$24.6M (first 9 months) (+42.6% Y/Y).
    • In addition, The company also expects to turn adjusted EBITDA positive in the Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • TLT

    Fed's George keeps her hawkish stance

    • Kansas City Fed President Esther George, who voted against the last two Fed rate cuts, isn't changing her stance.
    • "My own outlook for the economy does not call for a monetary policy response," she said at a speech in Denver today.
    • Translation: No monetary response means keep rates where they are.
    • Even with the recent weakness in manufacturing and business investment, monetary policy may not be the appropriate tool to offset the risks faced by businesses "when weighted against the costs that could be associated with such action," she added.
    • But she'll keep an eye on risks. "Should downside risks spill over into the broader economy in a way that fundamentally affects the consumer and shifts the overall outlook, a monetary policy response may be required," she concluded.
    • Markets have priced in a 25-basis-point rate cut for the FOMC meeting later this month; the CME FedWatch Tool puts the probability of a rate cut at 89%, up from 67% a week ago.
    • 10-year Treasury yield is down a basis point at 1.743%.
    • iShares 20+ Year Treasury Bond ETF (TLT +0.2%); ProShares UltraShort 20+ Year Treasury ETF (TBT -0.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 10 Comments
  • CJREF

    Corus -11.8% after flat Q4 with lower profits

    • Corus Entertainment (OTCPK:CJREF) is 11.8% lower after fiscal Q4 results with flat revenues despite some solid cash generation.
    • Television advertising grew, but revenues overall dropped fractionally to C$377.5M.
    • Attributable adjusted net income fell to C$27.9M from C$39.5M (the prior-year quarter was adjusted for the impact of acquisition, integration and restructuring costs of C$7.7M).
    • Consolidated segment profit was down 4% to C$109.8M.
    • Revenue breakout: Television, C$343.76M (down 0.3%); Radio, C$33.7M (down 2.1%).
    • Profit by segment: Television, C$108.6M (down 0.1%); Radio, C$6.9M (down 18.3%).
    • Free cash flow was C$93.6M, down 2.5%.
    • Earnings call slides
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 7 Comments

  • Marten Transport +4.2% post Q3 results

    • Marten Transport (MRTN +4.2%) reports Q3 revenue growth of 7.7% Y/Y to 214.9M.
    • Segment revenue: Truckload $94.99M (+1.1% Y/Y); Dedicated $70.3M (+19.6% Y/Y); Intermodal $22.3M (-14% Y/Y) & Brokerage of $27.4M (+30.3% Y/Y).
    • Operating margin: Total operating increased 20 bps to 90.7%; Truckload increased 340 bps to 92.7%; Dedicated declined 520 bps to 85.9%; Intermodal increased 430 bps to 94.6% & Brokerage declined 130 bps to 92.9%.
    • Fuel surcharge revenue decreased to $26.1M, from $27.9M same quarter last year.
    • Average revenue, net of fuel surcharges, per tractor per week: Truckload $3,723M; Dedicated $3,392M.
    • Average tractors: Truckload 1,695; Dedicated 1,329 & Intermodal 87.
    • Average miles per trip: Truckload 545; Dedicated 312.
    • Net cash provided by operating activities for the quarter was $46.1M, compared to $44.72M a year ago.
    • “We expect to continue expanding our capacity to service our customers by offering the best jobs for the industry’s best drivers.” said Randolph L. Marten, Chairman and CEO.
    • Previously: Marten Transport EPS beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Oct. 17 2019)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • TYME

    Tyme Tech down 8% on $30M stock sales deal

    • Tyme Technologies (TYME -8.2%) inks an agreement with Jefferies LLC for the at-the-market sale of up to $30M of its common stock. Jefferies will earn a 3% commission for its efforts.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • HUN

    Huntsman added to Jefferies Franchise Picks List

    • Huntsman (HUN +2.1%) heads higher after Jefferies adds the stock to the Franchise Picks List with a Buy rating and $28 price target, citing one of the strongest balance sheets in the chemicals space, a less cyclical mix but still significant operating leverage and innovation that should allow for growth ahead of GDP.
    • HUN "should be one of the first and fastest out of the gate" if leading indicators continue to turn and investors continue to embrace at least a modest cyclical reflation, says Jefferies analyst Laurence Alexander.
    • HUN has a path to $40-plus per share "in a sustained cyclical rally" and more than $60 "at the peak of a synchronized global up-cycle," Alexander says.
    • HUN's average Sell Side Rating and Seeking Alpha Authors Rating are Bullish/Outperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 1 Comment

  • Exponent slides 7.4% post Q3 results

    • Exponent (EXPO -7.4%) reports Q3 revenue growth of 6.6% Y/Y to $101.55M.
    • Revenues before reimbursements were $95.5M (+8% Y/Y) & Reimbursements of $6M (-8.3% Y/Y).
    • Operating margin increased 124 bps to 22.9% & EBITDA margin declined 40 bps to 25.6%.
    • In a separate press release today, the company announced a $0.16 quarterly dividend.
    • Year to date, Exponent distributed $25.2M in dividends and closed the period with $210M in cash, equivalents and short-term investments.
    • Outlook 2019: Expect revenues before reimbursements to grow in the high-single digits Y/Y and EBITDA margin to be down ~25 bps.
    • Previously: Exponent declares $0.16 dividend (Oct. 17 2019)
    • Previously: Exponent EPS beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Oct. 17 2019)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 3 Comments

  • CAT

    Caterpillar cut at Morgan Stanley on weakness in two biggest segments

    • Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) -1.8% pre-market after Morgan Stanley downgraded shares to Equal Weight from Overweight with a $145 price target, trimmed from $150, citing increasing downside risks to the company's Construction and Energy and Transportation segments.
    • Stanley analyst Courtney Yakavonis says CAT's U.S. Construction Equipment market peaked in 2019 and that its Energy and Transportation markets will fail to re-accelerate in 2020, prompting her to forecast negative growth in the company's two largest business segments in 2020.
    • CAT's Resources segment and share repurchases continue to support earnings but are unable to fully offset the other headwinds, Yakavonis says, as her updated CAT estimates now call for a mild Y/Y earnings decline in 2020.
    • CAT's average Sell Side Rating and Seeking Alpha Authors Rating are Neutral/Hold.

  • STT

    State Street Q3 beats on strong sequential NII growth (updated)

    • State Street (NYSE:STT) jumps 3.9% in premarket trading after Q3 adjusted EPS of $1.51 blows past the average analyst estimate of $1.40
    • "Despite an uncertain revenue environment, we saw sequential fee revenue growth in FX trading services in our Global Markets business and strong NII," said President and CEO Ron O'Hanley.
    • Q3 net interest income of $644M rose 5.1% Q/Q, fell 4.2% Y/Y; net interest margin on FTE basis of 1.42% increased from 1.38% in Q2 and fell from 1.48% in the year-ago quarter.
    • Q3 total fee revenue of $2.26B was flat vs. Q2 and fell 2.5% Y/Y.
    • Q3 pretax margin of 24.8% vs. 25.0% in Q2 and 29.9% in Q3 2018.
    • "While our pre-tax margin and return on equity fell short of medium-term targets, we remain committed to our 2019 expense program and the expected realization of $400M in savings by year end," O'Hanley said.
    • Investment Servicing mandates announced in Q3 totaled $1.0% with quarter-end servicing assets remaining to be installed in future periods of $1.2T.
    • Investment Management net inflows of $13B in Q3, driven by cash and ETF inflows.
    • Q3 assets under custody/administration of $32.9T, up 0.4% Q/Q and down 3.2% Y/Y.
    • Q3 assets under management of $2.95T, up 1.2% Q/Q and up 5.1% Y/Y.
    • Q3 return on average common equity of 9.7% slipped from 10.1% in Q2 and 14.0% in Q3 2018.
    • Q4 outlook: Sees fee revenue up 1%-2% sequentially, driven by CRD seasonality.
    • Sees Q4 NII down 3%-5% Q/Q, adjusting for Q3 2019 episodic market-related benefits, driven by lower long-end rates.
    • Sees expenses excluding notable items roughly flat vs. Q3.
    • Conference call at 10:00 AM ET.
    • Previously: State Street EPS beats by $0.11, beats on revenue (Oct. 18)

  • EGY

    Vaalco confirms oil discovery at Gabon appraisal well

    • Vaalco Energy (NYSE:EGY) +8.5% pre-market after saying it  encountered oil sands at its Etame appraisal well located offshore Gabon.
    • EGY says the first well of its three-well campaign offshore Gabon was successfully drilled to a total depth of 10,260 ft. and encountered both Gamba and Dentale oil sands.
    • EGY estimates gross recoverable oil resources of 2.5M-10.5M barrels of oil present in subcropping Dentale reservoirs.
    • The company also says the well identified an oil column which was thicker than expected in the Gamba reservoir, which may result in higher ultimate oil recovery from the two planned appraisal wells than previously expected.
